flavor: "Analyzing the board won't help. Your mistake was thinking we're playing the same game."
stripped_text: The first piece of ice the Corp rezzes each turn costs 1 credit more to rez.
text: The first piece of ice the Corp rezzes each turn costs 1[credit] more to rez.
title: Reina Roja: Freedom Fighter

flavor: You ever set something on fire just to watch it burn?
stripped_text: Run HQ or R&D. Access -> 0 credits: Trash the card you are accessing.
text: Run HQ or R&D. Access → 0[credit]: Trash the card you are accessing.
title: Demolition Run

stripped_text: Run Archives. If successful, instead of breaching Archives, you may install 1 program from your heap, ignoring all costs.
text: Run Archives. If successful, instead of breaching Archives, you may install 1 program from your heap, ignoring all costs.
title: Retrieval Run

stripped_text: As an additional cost to play this event, spend click. Run a remote server. If successful, instead of breaching that server, trash all cards installed in the root of that server.
text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Run a remote server. If successful, instead of breaching that server, trash all cards installed in the root of that server.
title: Singularity

stripped_text: Place 9 credits on this event, then run any server. During that run, hosted credits are considered to be in your credit pool. When the run ends, suffer 1 brain damage, which cannot be prevented. Errata from CR 1.4
text:
Place 9[credit] on this event, then run any server. During that run, hosted credits are considered to be in your credit pool. When the run ends, suffer 1 brain damage, which cannot be prevented.
<errata>Errata from CR 1.4</errata>
title: Stimhack

flavor: I feel almost naked without it.
stripped_text: 1 recurring credit Use this credit to pay for using icebreakers or for installing virus programs.
text: 1[recurring-credit] Use this credit to pay for using icebreakers or for installing virus programs.
title: Cyberfeeder

stripped_text: +1 mu, 2 recurring credits Use these credits to pay for using icebreakers. Whenever there is a successful trace during a run, suffer 1 brain damage. Limit 1 console per player.
text: +1[mu], 2[recurring-credit] Use these credits to pay for using icebreakers. Whenever there is a successful trace during a run, suffer 1 brain damage. Limit 1 console per player.
title: Spinal Modem

stripped_text: Interface -> 2 credits: Break 1 subroutine. X is equal to the number of hosted virus counters. When your turn begins, you may pay 1 credit to place 1 virus counter on this program.
text:
Interface → 2[credit]: Break 1 subroutine.
X is equal to the number of hosted virus counters.
When your turn begins, you may pay 1[credit] to place 1 virus counter on this program.
title: Darwin

stripped_text: Whenever you make a successful run on a central server, place 1 virus counter on Datasucker. Hosted virus counter: Rezzed piece of ice currently being encountered has -1 strength until the end of the encounter.
text: Whenever you make a successful run on a central server, place 1 virus counter on Datasucker. Hosted virus counter: Rezzed piece of ice currently being encountered has -1 strength until the end of the encounter.
title: Datasucker

flavor: It always strikes twice.
stripped_text: Interface -> 2 credits: Break up to 2 code gate subroutines. 1 credit: +1 strength.
text: Interface → 2[credit]: Break up to 2 code gate subroutines. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
title: Force of Nature

flavor: Something wicked this way comes.
stripped_text: When you install this program, place 2 virus counters on it. Access -> Hosted virus counter: Trash the card you are accessing. Use this ability only once per turn.
text: When you install this program, place 2 virus counters on it. Access → Hosted virus counter: Trash the card you are accessing. Use this ability only once per turn.
title: Imp

flavor: Bleeding data is more of a science than an art. Too much and you can end up with a one-way ticket to flatline city. Not enough and you might as well be running an empty server.
stripped_text: Whenever you make a successful run, place 1 virus counter on Hemorrhage. click, 2 hosted virus counters: The Corp trashes 1 card from HQ.
text: Whenever you make a successful run, place 1 virus counter on Hemorrhage. [click], 2 hosted virus counters: The Corp trashes 1 card from HQ.
title: Hemorrhage

flavor: November 5th: the day when all would see the corrupt machinations of the corporate oligarchy.
stripped_text: Interface -> 1 credit: Break 1 sentry subroutine.
text: Interface → 1[credit]: Break 1 sentry subroutine.
title: Mimic

flavor: Weaponizing the heavens, one star at a time.
stripped_text: Interface -> 1 credit: Break any number of barrier subroutines.
text: Interface → 1[credit]: Break any number of barrier subroutines.
title: Morning Star

flavor: In the public consciousness, there's a hard line between corp and runner. In the real world, things are a little more porous. The corps need the best hackers to run their networks, and some of the best hackers are ex-runners who like the idea of a regular paycheck. But sometimes things run the other way, and someone on the inside makes something like this.
stripped_text: While you are encountering a piece of ice, it gets -1 strength.
text: While you are encountering a piece of ice, it gets -1 strength.
title: Ice Carver

flavor: It's easier to spend when it's not your money.
stripped_text: When you install this resource, load 16 credits onto it. When it is empty, trash it. click: Take 4 credits from this resource.
text:
When you install this resource, load 16[credit] onto it. When it is empty, trash it.
[click]: Take 4[credit] from this resource.
title: Liberated Account

flavor: "They're mindless tools of destruction, good for little else. Nice guys, though. Some of my best friends are scrubbers." -Ji "Noise" Reilly
stripped_text: 2 recurring credits (When you install this card and before your turn begins, refill to 2 hosted credits.) You can spend hosted credits to pay trash costs.
text: 2[recurring-credit] (When you install this card and before your turn begins, refill to 2 hosted credits.) You can spend hosted credits to pay trash costs.
title: Scrubber

flavor:
And all should cry, Beware! Beware!
His flashing eyes, his floating hair!
Weave a circle round him thrice,
And close your eyes with holy dread,
For he on honey-dew hath fed,
And drunk the milk of Paradise.
-Samuel Taylor Coleridge
stripped_text: The rez cost of each piece of ice is increased by 1 credit.
text: The rez cost of each piece of ice is increased by 1[credit].
title: Xanadu

flavor: "Of course I steal from the rich. They're the ones with all the money."
stripped_text: The first time you make a successful run on HQ each turn, gain 2 credits.
text: The first time you make a successful run on HQ each turn, gain 2[credit].
title: Gabriel Santiago: Consummate Professional

flavor: "Hey kid, you fire that up now, bound to be vamped real bad. Some real pathetic individuals around here. But thankfully I got just the ticket…"
stripped_text: Gain 3 credits.
text: Gain 3[credit].
title: Easy Mark

flavor: "Think of it as a virtual shock collar for punishing corporate pets." -Andromeda
stripped_text: Play only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn. Derez 1 installed piece of ice.
text:
Play only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn.
Derez 1 installed piece of ice.
title: Emergency Shutdown

flavor: As the hysteria in the room climbed higher up the corporate chain, an uneasy feeling of joblessness began to sink in on the lower rungs.
stripped_text: Choose 1 unrezzed piece of ice. The Corp may rez that ice. If they do not, they trash it.
text: Choose 1 unrezzed piece of ice. The Corp may rez that ice. If they do not, they trash it.
title: Forged Activation Orders

flavor: "Hey, listen, I'm not asking you to do anything dangerous. Just let me into the building. And tell me which room has the weakest security. And please don't say 'the bathroom' again."
stripped_text: Run any server. The first time this run you encounter a piece of ice, bypass it.
text: Run any server. The first time this run you encounter a piece of ice, bypass it.
title: Inside Job

flavor: Feverishly tracking its frustratingly slow progress across the Pacific, the package finally shows up hours later…
stripped_text: Search your stack for an icebreaker, reveal it, and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack.
text: Search your stack for an icebreaker, reveal it, and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack.
title: Special Order

flavor: Twice the fun.
stripped_text: +1 mu Once per turn, you may immediately make another run when a successful run ends. Limit 1 console per player.
text: +1[mu] Once per turn, you may immediately make another run when a successful run ends. Limit 1 console per player.
title: Doppelgänger

flavor: If you don't have someone on the inside, find someone on the inside who's fond of desk ornaments.
stripped_text: Whenever you breach HQ, access 1 additional card.
text: Whenever you breach HQ, access 1 additional card.
title: HQ Interface

stripped_text: Interface -> 2 credits: Break 1 barrier subroutine. 2 credits: +3 strength.
text: Interface → 2[credit]: Break 1 barrier subroutine. 2[credit]: +3 strength.
title: Aurora

flavor: Do you believe in faeries?
stripped_text: Interface -> 0 credits: Break 1 sentry subroutine. 1 credit: +1 strength. Whenever an encounter ends, if you used this program to break a subroutine during that encounter, trash this program.
text: Interface → 0[credit]: Break 1 sentry subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength. Whenever an encounter ends, if you used this program to break a subroutine during that encounter, trash this program.
title: Faerie

stripped_text: Interface -> 1 credit: Break 1 sentry subroutine. 2 credits: +1 strength. When you install this program, choose 1 installed piece of ice. Whenever you encounter the chosen ice, you may pay 1 credit for each subroutine it has. If you do, bypass that ice.
text: Interface → 1[credit]: Break 1 sentry subroutine. 2[credit]: +1 strength. When you install this program, choose 1 installed piece of ice. Whenever you encounter the chosen ice, you may pay 1[credit] for each subroutine it has. If you do, bypass that ice.
title: Femme Fatale

flavor: Show-off.
stripped_text: Interface -> 2 credits: Break 1 code gate subroutine. 2 credits: +3 strength.
text: Interface → 2[credit]: Break 1 code gate subroutine. 2[credit]: +3 strength.
title: Peacock

stripped_text: X recurring credits Use these credits during runs on HQ. X is the number of virus counters on Pheromones. Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, place 1 virus counter on Pheromones.

X[recurring-credit]
Use these credits during runs on HQ. X is the number of virus counters on Pheromones.

title: Pheromones

flavor: "The code isn't important. It's where the code takes you that is important." -g00ru
stripped_text: click: Run Archives. If that run would be declared successful, change the attacked server to HQ for the remainder of that run.
text: [click]: Run Archives. If that run would be declared successful, change the attacked server to HQ for the remainder of that run.
title: Sneakdoor Beta

stripped_text: When you install this resource, load 8 credits on it. When it is empty, trash it. Whenever you make a successful run on a remote server, instead of breaching that server, you may take any number of credits from this resource.
text:
When you install this resource, load 8[credit] on it. When it is empty, trash it.
Whenever you make a successful run on a remote server, instead of breaching that server, you may take any number of credits from this resource.
title: Bank Job

flavor: "My roomie, he had a cousin with a college girlfriend whose brother's best friend was an addict, and the addict's mother used to live here. So yeah, there's a connection." -Lez "Rockfist" S.
stripped_text: 2 recurring credits Use these credits to pay for removing tags. trash: Prevent up to 3 meat damage.
text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to pay for removing tags.
[trash]: Prevent up to 3 meat damage.
title: Crash Space

flavor: There are good, honest, hardworking cops in the NAPD. Officers who do their best to bring justice to the guilty and protect the innocent. Fortunately for the criminals, they're outnumbered by the other kind. The kind who are much easier to work with.
stripped_text: trash: Prevent another installed resource from being trashed. trash: Gain 2 credits.
text:
[trash]: Prevent another installed resource from being trashed.
[trash]: Gain 2[credit].
title: Fall Guy

flavor:
"We're always happy to help, Mr. Santiago."
"I appreciate it, Mr. Li."
"We'll be in touch. And, Gabriel…"
"Yes?"
"Don't leave town."
stripped_text: click: Draw 2 cards. When you do, add 1 of those cards to the bottom of your stack.
text: [click]: Draw 2 cards. When you do, add 1 of those cards to the bottom of your stack.
title: Mr. Li

flavor: "Have you met Dinosaurus?"
stripped_text: +1 mu
title: Chaos Theory: Wünderkind

flavor: Diesel gives you flames.
stripped_text: Draw 3 cards.
text: Draw 3 cards.
title: Diesel

flavor: A little corporate restructuring is necessary once in a while.
stripped_text: Run R&D. If successful, instead of breaching R&D, you may look at the top 5 cards of R&D and arrange them in any order.
text: Run R&D. If successful, instead of breaching R&D, you may look at the top 5 cards of R&D and arrange them in any order.
title: Indexing

flavor: There's no replacement for a home-grown program. Fed on late nights, oaty bars, and single-minded determination. Cheaper, too.
stripped_text: Install a program or piece of hardware, lowering the install cost by 3.
text: Install a program or piece of hardware, lowering the install cost by 3.
title: Modded

flavor: When you're this good, it's hard not to grow a fan base.
stripped_text: Play only if you made a successful run on R&D, HQ, and Archives this turn. Add Notoriety to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.
text:
Play only if you made a successful run on R&D, HQ, and Archives this turn.
Add Notoriety to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.
title: Notoriety

stripped_text: Search either your stack or your heap for 1 program. (Shuffle your stack if you searched it.) Install that program, ignoring all costs. When your turn ends, if that program has not been uninstalled, add it to the top of your stack.
text: Search either your stack or your heap for 1 program. (Shuffle your stack if you searched it.) Install that program, ignoring all costs. When your turn ends, if that program has not been uninstalled, add it to the top of your stack.
title: Test Run

flavor: "Some of the professionals have good instincts, but they can't see beyond the data. They can't see the matrix." -Ele "Smoke" Scovak
stripped_text: Run R&D. If successful, access 2 additional cards when you breach R&D.
text: Run R&D. If successful, access 2 additional cards when you breach R&D.
title: The Maker's Eye

flavor: "There's that moment, you know, when the whole world seems to fall away and it is only you and your mod, and the mod is the world."
stripped_text: Choose a piece of ice. That ice gains sentry, code gate, and barrier until the end of the turn.
text: Choose a piece of ice. That ice gains sentry, code gate, and barrier until the end of the turn.
title: Tinkering

stripped_text: Dinosaurus can host a single non-AI icebreaker. The memory cost of the hosted icebreaker does not count against your memory limit. Hosted icebreaker has +2 strength. Limit 1 console per player.
text: Dinosaurus can host a single non-AI icebreaker. The memory cost of the hosted icebreaker does not count against your memory limit. Hosted icebreaker has +2 strength. Limit 1 console per player.
title: Dinosaurus

flavor: It's not endless, it just feels that way.

text:
+1[link]
When Rabbit Hole is installed, you may search your stack for another copy of Rabbit Hole and install it by paying its install cost. Shuffle your stack.
title: Rabbit Hole

flavor: A z-loop here, a cortical wave there…
stripped_text: Install The Personal Touch only on an icebreaker. Host icebreaker has +1 strength.
text: Install The Personal Touch only on an icebreaker. Host icebreaker has +1 strength.
title: The Personal Touch

flavor: "It's called 'brute-forcing' and it's just as effective today as it was a hundred years ago." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey
stripped_text: Interface -> 2 credits: Break up to 2 barrier subroutines. 1 credit: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
text: Interface → 2[credit]: Break up to 2 barrier subroutines. 1[credit]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
title: Battering Ram

flavor: It can slice through the thickest knots of data.
stripped_text: Interface -> 1 credit: Break 1 code gate subroutine. 1 credit: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
text: Interface → 1[credit]: Break 1 code gate subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
title: Gordian Blade

flavor: The Great Work was completed on a rainy Thursday afternoon. There were no seismic shifts, no solar flares, no sign from the earth or heavens that the world had changed. But upstalk in Heinlein, on a single Cybsoft manufactured datacore, the flickering data quantums of an account began to fill with creds. Real, honest-to-goodness UN certified creds.
stripped_text: click: Gain 2 credits.
text: [click]: Gain 2[credit].
title: Magnum Opus

stripped_text: Interface -> 1 credit: Break 1 sentry subroutine. 2 credits: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
text: Interface → 1[credit]: Break 1 sentry subroutine. 2[credit]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
title: Pipeline

flavor: You didn't mention Aesop's arm unless you wanted an earful. Sometimes he talked about it in such a way that you wondered why he didn't laser his other arm off as well.
stripped_text: When your turn begins, you may trash 1 of your other installed cards. If you do, gain 3 credits.
text: When your turn begins, you may trash 1 of your other installed cards. If you do, gain 3[credit].
title: Aesop's Pawnshop

flavor: "I don't care what the studies show. From my experience, I can ingest three cans of Diesel an hour for up to twelve hours before going into cardiac arrest." -heard during the eleventh hour
stripped_text: click, trash: Gain click click.
text: [click], [trash]: Gain [click][click].
title: All-nighter

flavor: The life expectancy of a jacked construct is about that of a mayfly. In other words, short.

text: [trash]: Prevent an installed program or an installed piece of hardware from being trashed.
title: Sacrificial Construct

flavor: "Bring back any memories, Monica?" -John "Animal" McEvoy
stripped_text: Gain 2 credits or expose 1 card.
text: Gain 2[credit] or expose 1 card.
title: Infiltration

flavor: Lady Luck took the form of a hifi quantum manipulation ring that she wore on her middle finger.
stripped_text: Gain 9 credits.
text: Gain 9[credit].
title: Sure Gamble

flavor: Archaic but reliable.

text: +1[mu], +1[link]

flavor: Drudge work, but it pays the bills.

flavor: "My boss rewards quality work. If you know what's good for you, you'll keep it up."

text: When your turn begins, gain 1[credit] if you have at least 2[link].
title: Underworld Contact

flavor: A Different Breed of Machine.

text: All bioroid ice has +1 strength.
title: Haas-Bioroid: Stronger Together

flavor: Who wants to start a war?

Aggressive Secretary can be advanced.
If you pay 2[credit] when the Runner accesses Aggressive Secretary, trash 1 program for each advancement token on Aggressive Secretary.

flavor: I hear the shift of every bit amid the flow of the datastream. I hear the whispers of my mothers, and their commands are law. The realm beyond is forbidden.

flavor: I'm not here to play games. The game is over.

flavor: My reputation would precede me, if any could speak of it.

flavor: "Do you think they…feel it?"

text: Add 1 card from Archives to HQ.
title: Archived Memories

flavor: "Why of course, we have six different Haas-Bioroid models serving in a variety of positions at this branch office alone. We here at Haas-Bioroid aren't going to shy away from practicing what we preach, and we pass the savings from increased efficiency on to our valued customers."
stripped_text: Gain click click.
text: Gain [click][click].
title: Biotic Labor

flavor: Green-two clearance is the highest level of security a corp can gain access to. Legally, anyway.
stripped_text: Gain 3 credits and draw 1 card.
text: Gain 3[credit] and draw 1 card.

flavor: The new heads were in. Their eyes always followed your movements when you unlocked the pressurized container and lifted the lid.

flavor: "Eyes forward, please."

title: Snare!

flavor: Himitsu-Bako is a simple ice barrier that appears as a digital puzzle box. What makes it special is the ease with which it can be uninstalled and installed in a different server, throwing up barriers in unexpected places and giving any intruder a curious feeling of déjà vu.

text:
1[credit]: Add Himitsu-Bako to HQ.
[subroutine] End the run.

Forged by Ak.wa on 23.11.79-23. Filed 23.11.79-23.2 with #34k-lw3-21HH-4i.

text: [subroutine] Do 3 net damage.
title: Neural Katana

flavor: Writing a program that can pass the Turing test is easy. The Gibson-Akamatsu test is a higher bar, and the only AIs to clear it thus far have been the androids. Even some humans have been known to fail.
stripped_text: The Runner cannot break subroutines on this ice using AI programs. Subroutine Trash 1 installed AI program. Subroutine Do 1 net damage.
text: The Runner cannot break subroutines on this ice using AI programs. [subroutine] Trash 1 installed AI program. [subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
title: Swordsman

flavor: Most runners do their business in full-sim, with their rigs wired directly into their brains. The setup has a large number of advantages, with the runner able to process data and input commands far faster than a traditional meat-bound system. But it also means greater risk.
stripped_text: Subroutine Do 2 net damage. Subroutine End the run.
text:
[subroutine] Do 2 net damage.
[subroutine] End the run.
title: Wall of Thorns

flavor: "This ice sucks." -g00ru
stripped_text: Subroutine The Runner cannot jack out for the remainder of this run. Trash Whirlpool.
text: [subroutine] The Runner cannot jack out for the remainder of this run. Trash Whirlpool.
title: Whirlpool

flavor: The 'cyber-war' is a war of information, and in a war of information, advance warning can be as good as a killing blow. -Michael Muhama, Musings on Cybercrime
stripped_text: Subroutine Look at the top card of R&D. You may add that card to the bottom of R&D. Subroutine Do 1 net damage.
text:
[subroutine] Look at the top card of R&D. You may add that card to the bottom of R&D.
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
title: Yagura

flavor: When Miranda Rhapsody showed up with a teacup giraffe, suddenly everybody wanted one.
stripped_text: As an additional cost to play this operation, spend click. Reveal up to 5 cards in HQ. Gain 2 credits for each card you revealed this way.
text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Reveal up to 5 cards in HQ. Gain 2[credit] for each card you revealed this way.
title: Celebrity Gift

flavor: The trick isn't hitting the person you were aiming at. It's hitting only the person you were aiming at.
stripped_text: Play only if the Runner made a run during his or her last turn. Do 1 net damage.
text:
Play only if the Runner made a run during his or her last turn.
Do 1 net damage.
title: Neural EMP

flavor: Smoke and mirrors optional.
stripped_text: Choose 1 installed card you can advance. Move up to 2 advancement counters from 1 other card to the chosen card.
text: Choose 1 installed card you can advance. Move up to 2 advancement counters from 1 other card to the chosen card.
title: Trick of Light

flavor: Despite its appearance, the Hokusai Grid is the most notorious research facility at Jinteki.
stripped_text: Whenever the Runner makes a successful run on this server, do 1 net damage. Limit 1 region per server.
text: Whenever the Runner makes a successful run on this server, do 1 net damage. Limit 1 region per server.
title: Hokusai Grid

flavor: Someone is Always Watching.
stripped_text: 2 recurring credits Use these credits during trace attempts.
text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits during trace attempts.
title: NBN: Making News

stripped_text: When you score this agenda, place 1 agenda counter on it for every 2 hosted advancement counters past 3. This agenda is worth 1 more agenda point for each hosted agenda counter.
text:
When you score this agenda, place 1 agenda counter on it for every 2 hosted advancement counters past 3.
This agenda is worth 1 more agenda point for each hosted agenda counter.
title: Project Beale

flavor: "The damn raven just kind of cawed at me as I went past. I should have known it was too good to be true."
stripped_text: If TGTBT is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it. When the Runner accesses TGTBT, give the Runner 1 tag.
text:
If TGTBT is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.

stripped_text: When the Runner encounters Data Raven, he or she must either take 1 tag or end the run. Hosted power counter: Give the Runner 1 tag. Subroutine Trace 3 If successful, place 1 power counter on Data Raven.
text: When the Runner encounters Data Raven, he or she must either take 1 tag or end the run. Hosted power counter: Give the Runner 1 tag. [subroutine] Trace 3 If successful, place 1 power counter on Data Raven.
title: Data Raven

flavor: A bright light blossomed, and then the console went dark. That's when she smelled smoke.
stripped_text: Subroutine Trace 6 If successful, trash 1 piece of hardware, do 2 meat damage (cannot be prevented), and end the run.
text: [subroutine]<trace>Trace 6</trace> If successful, trash 1 piece of hardware, do 2 meat damage (cannot be prevented), and end the run.
title: Flare

flavor: "Try to close it. Go on. See what it does." -Chaos Theory

text:
When the Runner encounters this ice, gain 1[credit].

title: Pop-up Window

flavor:
"Ever heard of a catch-22?"
"Remind me to forget it."
stripped_text: When the Runner encounters this ice, they must pay 3 credits, if able. If they do not, end the run. Subroutine End the run.
text:
When the Runner encounters this ice, they must pay 3[credit], if able. If they do not, end the run.

flavor: "It can make a real fine roller coaster, provided you're properly stimmed up." -Noise

flavor: "Please stay connected. Priority transfer in progress. An operator will shortly verif-"

text: Draw 3 cards.

flavor: Access to the largest consumer database in the galaxy has its advantages.

title: Psychographics

flavor: Keeping tabs on the world, one screen at a time.

flavor: Moving Upwards.

flavor: There are going to be some changes around here.

title: Project Atlas

flavor: "I use bioroids because I can wipe their memories or just blow their brains out when the job is done. No witnesses means no witnesses."

text:

title: The Cleaners

flavor: They don't call them dedicated for nothing.

text: If the Runner is tagged, Dedicated Response Team gains "Whenever a successful run ends, do 2 meat damage."
title: Dedicated Response Team

flavor: "It's not personal. Urban renewal is a necessity of the modern world. It's always someone's home, yours is no different."
stripped_text: When you rez Elizabeth Mills, remove 1 bad publicity. click, trash: Trash 1 location. Take 1 bad publicity.
text: When you rez Elizabeth Mills, remove 1 bad publicity. [click], [trash]: Trash 1 location. Take 1 bad publicity.
title: Elizabeth Mills

flavor: GRNDL refineries process many different rare elements unearthed during the fracking process.

text:
GRNDL Refinery can be advanced.
[click], [trash]: Gain 4[credit] for each advancement token on GRNDL Refinery.

flavor: Next time, read the Terms of Service more carefully. Or you might find yourself in the danger zone.

flavor: Who knows what evil lurks in the memory diamonds of men? Weyland knows. -unsigned cyber-graffiti

title: Shadow

flavor: The New Angeles Space Elevator, better known as the Beanstalk, is the single greatest triumph of human engineering and ingenuity in history. The Beanstalk makes Earth orbit accessible to everyone…for a small fee.
stripped_text: Gain 3 credits.
text: Gain 3[credit].
title: Beanstalk Royalties

flavor: "I'd say it's nothing personal, but corporations are people, too."
stripped_text: Trace 5. If successful, do X meat damage. X is equal to the sum of the printed agenda points on all agendas the Runner stole during their last turn.
text: <trace>Trace 5</trace>. If successful, do X meat damage. X is equal to the sum of the printed agenda points on all agendas the Runner stole during their last turn.
title: Punitive Counterstrike

flavor:
"And then there's these two crates. No eID."
"Just leave those with me and forget you ever saw them."

text: Place 1 advancement token on each of up to 2 different installed cards that can be advanced.
title: Shipment from Kaguya

flavor: It didn't look like the headquarters of a multi-billion cred company. Probably because it wasn't.

title: False Lead

flavor: "If it isn't in my terminal by six p.m., heads are going to roll!"

text: When you score Priority Requisition, you may rez a piece of ice ignoring all costs.
title: Priority Requisition

flavor: "Expensive? Not when you're protecting a fortune as large as ours."
stripped_text: If the Runner is tagged, Private Security Force gains: "click: Do 1 meat damage."
text: If the Runner is tagged, Private Security Force gains: "[click]: Do 1 meat damage."
title: Private Security Force

flavor: "The mining bosses are worse than any downstalk crime lords. Tri-Maf, 4K, Yak, I don't care what gangs you got down there. In Heinlein there's just one law: the He3 must flow." -"Old" Rick Henry, escaped clone.
stripped_text: click, click, click: Gain 7 credits.
text: [click], [click], [click]: Gain 7[credit].
title: Melange Mining Corp.

flavor: It is just like the one you just bought, only better.
stripped_text: When your turn begins, gain 1 credit.
text: When your turn begins, gain 1[credit].
title: PAD Campaign

flavor:
"Hey, hey! Wake up, man. You were under a long time. What'd you see?"
"I…don't remember."

text: [subroutine] End the run.
title: Wall of Static

flavor: Hedge Fund. Noun. An ingenious device by which the rich get richer even while every other poor SOB is losing his shirt. -The Anarch's Dictionary, Volume Who's Counting?
stripped_text: Gain 9 credits.
text: Gain 9[credit].
title: Hedge Fund
